title: Missing baby found unharmed in Prince George’s County
text:
A 3-month-old boy was found unharmed Tuesday night shortly after the baby’s disappearance was publicized by Prince George’s County police.

The child was identified by police as Ludwig Umanzor-Luna.

In a statement earlier Tuesday, police said the boy’s mother had reported giving him to a woman Monday but could not recall her identity or where the child was left.

At an evening news conference, Police Chief Hank Stawinski said the baby was being cared for by a woman whom he described as very responsible.

Stawinski said police had not yet determined how the child came to be in the woman’s care. He said that he did not think she knew that the child was missing and that she contacted police after seeing a report about the disappearance.

The child’s mother was not identified by name, but police released her photograph earlier Tuesday evening to aid in the search for the child.

description: The 3-month-old boy’s mother reported that she gave him to an unidentified woman on Monday, police said.
